update.description:
~~This builds on top of pull request #2949 and needs [this](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-fuel-tools/pull-requests/73/fix-returned-download-path-for-tip/diff) Fuel-tools PR.~~

---

Adds support for full Fuel URLs in SDF's `<uri>` tag.

Most models on Fuel use the `model://` scheme, but you can try [this coffee maker](https://ignitionfuel.org/chapulina/models/Coffee%20Maker), which has the following SDF:

~~~
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.5">
  <model name="coffee_maker">
    <static>true</static>
    <link name="link">
      <visual name="visual">
        <geometry>
          <mesh>
            <uri>https://api.ignitionfuel.org/1.0/chapulina/models/Coffee Maker/tip/files/meshes/coffee_maker.obj</uri>
            <scale>0.01 0.01 0.01</scale>
          </mesh>
        </geometry>
      </visual>
    </link>
  </model>
</sdf>
~~~




![coffeefuel.gif](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/1388587355-coffeefuel.gif)

content.raw: ok I see. Add to todo comment to investigate why this msg is being printed many times?
content.html: ok I see. Add to todo comment to investigate why this msg is being printed many times?

pull_request.title: Fuel: Support models with full Fuel URLs in <uri>

pullrequest.title: Fuel: Support models with full Fuel URLs in <uri>

content.raw:
Yeah I thought about that. I'll remove the "found in cache" messages, but I'll leave the "downloaded" ones because I think it's good to let users know when we're writing to disk.

As to it being printed many times - that should be the number of times in which Gazebo is accessing the file. Since the coffee maker mesh is only a visual, I'd expect at most once for the client and once for the server - if there was a camera sensor. So I think it would be worth it investigating why this resource is being loaded so many times.
content.html:
Yeah I thought about that. I'll remove the "found in cache" messages, but I'll leave the "downloaded" ones because I think it's good to let users know when we're writing to disk.

As to it being printed many times - that should be the number of times in which Gazebo is accessing the file. Since the coffee maker mesh is only a visual, I'd expect at most once for the client and once for the server - if there was a camera sensor. So I think it would be worth it investigating why this resource is being loaded so many times.

content.raw: this message seems to get printed out many times for the same \`coffee\_maker.obj\` file? Any ideas? Maybe we don’t need to be that verbose?
content.html: this message seems to get printed out many times for the same `coffee_maker.obj` file? Any ideas? Maybe we don’t need to be that verbose?
